result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan S. Harnden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jonathan S. Harnden is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jonathan S. Harnden was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan S. Harnden

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Deft is currently incarcerated and awaiting sentencing after revocation - all fine review hearings will be set at that date and time per the request of Atty Lynch.  12/15/2016 @ 3:00 p.m.

2:42 p.m. Defendant Jonathan S. Harnden in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Jonathan S. Harnden in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Lynch/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Imposed and Stayed - 90 daysJail
POP - 1 year
Supervision Fees
Fine - $100 plus costs
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail credit - 25 days if revoked.
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights and payment plan application given.
Adj. 2:49 pm. 
  Review hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:36 p.m. Defendant Jonathan S. Harnden in court in custody via video with attorney Chad Lynch.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Court signs No contact waiver. Lynch moves to modify bond - to signature bond with same conditions - Bendar has no objections but asks for no abusive contact with Crawford.
Bail continued. Adj. 2:37 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
No contact with Cynthia Crawford. No intoxicants, no taverns. No entry upon victim's premises

1:44 p.m. Defendant Jonathan S. Harnden in court, via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Bendar statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
